page.title: 13Tockwith Schoolgirl.
page.content: A day in the life of Helen Wilson. A typical day for me begins at 6.30am when my alarm clock rings. While I eat my breakfast of cereal, toast and orange juice, I watch "Good Morning Britain" or a video cartoon on the television. I get washed, dressed and pick up my packed lunch. Mum gives me a lift to school in the car. I have time to meet friends in the playground before lessons begin at 9 o'clock. Our morning lessons include English, maths and science, and assembly when the whole school meets in the hall. After an hour for dinner and play, we have art and craft, reading and sometimes a game of rounders on the field. At 3.30 we walk home. I go to ballet and tap-dancing. After that, youth club and then home to watch TV and finally to bed at 9.30.
